description: Demolition of extensions on Nos. 6-12 Florence Road; Conversion of 6-12 Florence Road to form 2 houses (Nos. 10 and 12), 9 flats (Nos. 6 and 8); 3 new detached houses to rear, on-site parking, cycle and bin storage, hard and soft landscaping
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of the materials to be used in the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matter which have been given in this application.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B5, B21, B24 and B24a; Replacement UDP policies 4.1, 4.7, 4.8 and 5.5. | Dustbin and enclosed refuse area, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, shall be sited a maximum distance of 23 metres (10 metres where paladins are employed) from an adopted highway, and a maximum of 25 metres from any dwelling unit intended to use them. Such details as approved shall be implemented before first occupation of the development and thereafter retained.  Reason: To comply with the Council's Design Guides, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B5 & H34; Replacement UDP policies 4.1 and 5.5. | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscape works including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the phased programme agrees by the local planning authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.    Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B2, ES4 and H26; Replacement UDP policies 4.2, 4.5 and 5.5. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, No additions or extensions to the dwellinghouses, to the roof, the shape of the roof, the construction of a porch outside any external door of a house or building within the curtilage of a porch shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B5, B8, H26 and H27; Replacement UDP policies 4.1 and 5.5. | Details of access for people with disabilities shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before any work is commenced; and the approved scheme shall be implemented before the first occupation of residential accommodation, and shall be permanently retained.   Reason: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B6, ES3, H12; Replacement UDP policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected and shall ensure that sightlines of 1.5m by 1.5m and there are no obstructions to visibility above 0.6m high. The details as approved shall be completed before the residential units are first occupied and permanently retained.   Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B5, B20, B21, B24, B24a and ES2; Replacement UDP policies 4.1, 4.4, 4.7, 4.8 and 5.5. | Before any works commence on site, details of a scheme to provide parking for cyclists in accordance with adopted standards shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently.   Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1 and T15; Replacement UDP policy 9.6. | Demolition of the extensions to 6- 12 Florence Road shown on the approved drawings nos. TA 923/55 and 56, shall be carried out prior to first occupation of each of the properties 6-12 Florence Road, W5.  Reason: In the interests of protecting the appearance and character of the existing buildings and locality and in the interests of living conditions of these properties and adjoining properties, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies, B1, B5, B8, ES6, H26, H27 and Replacement UDP policies 4.1 and 5.5. | Details including a method statement to protect trees to be retained within the site and trees in the adjoining gardens to BS5837, shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing prior to the commencement of work and the implementation shall be accordance with the approved details/method statement.  Reason: To prevent damage to the trees in the interest of the character and appearance of the area, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy ES4; Replacement UDP policy 4.5. | The area beneath the spread of the branches of the trees to be retained as shown on the approved drawings shall not be used for the storage of building materials, plant, machinery or other items, or for vehicular access or for the burning of materials of any kind.  Reason: To prevent damage of the trees in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy B1, B5, B8 and H33; Replacement UDP policy 4.1 and 5.5. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the nos. 10 and 12 Florence Road, W5 and the 3no. Residential properties to the rear permitted.  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B5, B8, H26 and H27; Replacement UDP policy 4.1, 4.3, 4,4 and 5.5. | No development shall take place until a schedule of landscape maintenance for a minimum period of 5 years has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The schedule shall include details of its arrangement for its implementation. Landscape maintenance shall be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule.  Reason: To protect the landscaping in the interests of the visual character of the area, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy ES4 ; Replacement UDP policy 4.5. | Prior to commencement of development, details of the design of the building and car/cycle parking area aiming to comply with the requirements of Secure By Design shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development and shall be permanently retained.  Reason: In the interest of the safety of the occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy B1, B20, H26 and H27; Replacement UDP policies 4.1, 4.3, 4.4 and 5.5. | No part of development hereby permitted shall be occupied or brought into use before the access between the building and front forecourt and between the front forecourt onto the highway has been constructed as approved so to allow insofar as they can be achieved within the land under the control of the applicant sightlines of 1.5m by 1.5m, and that the land be kept clear of any obstructions to visibility above a height of 0.6m.  Reason: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy T50; Replacement UDP policy 9.1. | Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planing Authority before commencement of the development to demonstrate noise mitigation measures to protect the building envelope (roof, walls and windows) from aircraft noise, to a criteria of not less than 47dB(A)Leq, 1 hour (0700-2300hrs). The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation and thereafter permanently retained.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the development, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B8 and ES5 and Replacement UDP policies 4.1 and 4.11. | Details shall be submitted to and approved by the lcoal planning authority before commencement of the development of the means of mechanical ventilation to be employed, in order to secure adequate ventilation with windows fully closed. Silenced mechanical ventilator units must have at least two different airflow settings and the self noise at highest setting must be less than 40dB (A0 at the highest setting and 35dB (A) at the lowest setting. The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation and thereafter retained.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the development, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP polices B1, B8 and ES5 and Replacement UDP policies 4.1 and 4.11. | The car parking spaces shown on the approved plan TA 923/51C shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site in accordance with the Council's adopted policy T51 and Replacement policy 9.1. | The proposed windows first and second floor level in the north and southern elevations of the proposed 3 detached properties to the rear of the site as approved shall contain only obscure glass, and shall be permanently fixed shut. A sample of the obscured glass, no smaller than 300mm square shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development, and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the sample thus approved. The details so approved shall be retained permanently.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with the Council's adopted B1, B5, B8, H26 and H27 policies and replacement UDP policies 4.1 and 5.5.
